text: Chester Hills was author of "The Builder's Guide", an architectural pattern book published in 1846, which, like those of Minard Lafever, influenced architecture in the United States. It is a "practical treatise" on Greek and Roman style architecture. Two buildings influenced are in Rye, New York: Lounsberry and the 1838 Peter Augustus Jay House within the Boston Post Road Historic District., ==See also== *1838 Peter Augustus Jay House ==References== Category:1798 births Category:1854 deaths Category:American architecture writers Category:19th-century American architects
title: Chester Hills
